page.title: 14OLD LOCAL BUILDINGS.
page.content: Penistone and the area around have many old buildings which are of historic interest. In the very centre of Penistone is the Cloth Hall now a chemists. This is where the local Penistone wool cloth was sold to passing cloth merchants. Next to the Cloth Hall is St John's Church the parish church of Penistone. Its tower is a local landmark which can be seen from the hills. The River Don passes through Penistone and on its banks can be found the remains of Penistone's industrial past with oil,corn and woollen mills also weavers cottages. Other buildings of note include Water Hall, Netherfields (Penistone workhouse)the 6th form block of the grammar school.
